description: Uncertain. Possibly from dialectal English doddle (“to toddle; sway; nod drowsily”).

entries.meaning: (Britain, informal) A job, task, or other activity that is easy to complete or simple.
examples: Synonyms: breeze, cinch, piece of cake; see also Thesaurus:easy thing

verbs.description: doddle (third-person singular simple present doddles, present participle doddling, simple past and past participle doddled)

examples: […]  a doddling old grandfather to act as sheep-dog, as a toothless, barkless, harmless guardian.
Usually we doddled, stopping to flush quail or dove for dinner, skeet-shooting our beer bottles, and watering the cacti.

entries.meaning: A hornless animal; a pollard or doddy.
